intro: Hoffmannseggella flava, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb with succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. Hoffmannseggella flava plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is often found in disturbed or dry environments.
